memberdef.definition: typedef ReinitializableNumericalIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType > tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::ReinitializableNumericalIntegratorBase
memberdef.name: ReinitializableNumericalIntegratorBase

detaileddescription.para: Typedef of the base class with all template parameters filled in.

memberdef.definition: typedef ReinitializableNumericalIntegratorBase::NumericalIntegratorBase:: StateDerivativeFunction tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::StateDerivativeFunction
memberdef.name: StateDerivativeFunction

briefdescription.para: Typedef for the state derivative function.

detaileddescription.para:
Typedef to the state derivative function inherited from the base class.
NumericalIntegrator::StateDerivativeFunction.
Current independent variable as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).
Current state as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).
Last independent variable value as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).
Parameter that limits the value of the step size. Important to have to prevent infinite halving. Not initialised, constructor does so.
Parameter that limits the value of the step size. Not really important, can be set pretty high. Not initialised, constructor does so.
Parameter that limits the truncation error. Which drives stepsize control. Not initialised, constructor does so.
Parameter that limits the truncation error. Which drives stepsize control. Not initialised, constructor does so.
Parameter that increases performance. Which drives stepsize control. Advisable to set at least 200 to prevent flutter. Not initialised, constructor does so.
Fixes to step if set to true, can be manipulated through setFixedStepSize( ).
For a error vector to be better than another all its elements must be equal or small. Not strict compares the norm of the vectors instead.
Fixes to order if set to true, can be manipulated through setFixedOrder( ).
Truncation error to be estimated by estimateAbsoluteError( ).
Truncation error to be estimated by estimateRelativeError( ).

memberdef.definition: unsigned int tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::minimumOrder_
memberdef.name: minimumOrder_

detaileddescription.para: Minimum order allowed. True mininum is 1, but very imprecise. Advised to be at least three.

memberdef.definition: unsigned int tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::maximumOrder_
memberdef.name: maximumOrder_

detaileddescription.para: Maximum order allowed. True maximum is 12, based on predetermined coefficients. However, double precision has shown to be incapable of estimation twelfth-order errors.

memberdef.definition: unsigned int tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::order_
memberdef.name: order_

detaileddescription.para: Dynamic order. Starts at minimumOrder_ and is changed using order-control. Advisable to change for fixth-order integration runs.

Boolean value whether to only take fixed steps with the single-step integrator or whether to allow stepsize and error control by the integrator. While filling the first entry of then initial state and derivate history this can help to determine an appropriate step-size, but is undesirable for subsequent entries.
Last used step size, passed to either integrateTo( ) or performIntegrationStep( ).
Current state as computed by performIntegrationStep( ), after execution of performPredictorStep( ).
History of states, dynamic deque size depends on order.
History of derivatives, dynamic deque size depends on order.
Last state as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).
Last step size as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).
Last state derivative as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).

memberdef.definition: const double tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::truncationErrorCoefficients
memberdef.name: truncationErrorCoefficients

detaileddescription.para: Truncation error coefficients ( size: 1 x o )
Single step integrator to perform intitialization of multi-step history. Truncation error coefficients.
Coefficients for estimating the truncation error.
truncationErrorCoefficients( o - 1 )

memberdef.definition: const double tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::extrapolationCoefficients
memberdef.name: extrapolationCoefficients

detaileddescription.para: Extrapolation coefficients ( size: o * 2 X o )
Coefficients of predictor and corrector extrapolation polynomials.
extrapolationCoefficients( o * 2 - 2, i ) < predictor coefficients extrapolationCoefficients( o * 2 - 1, i ) < corrector coefficients

memberdef.definition: const double tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::interpolationCoefficients
memberdef.name: interpolationCoefficients

detaileddescription.para: Interpolation coefficients ( size: o^2-o X 2 * o )
Coefficients of state and derivative mid-points used during halving.

interpolationCoefficients( ( o - 1 )^2 - o + 1 + j, i ) < state coefficients for state history interpolationCoefficients( ( o - 1 )^2 - o + 1 + j, o + i ) < state coefficients for deriv history interpolationCoefficients( ( o - 1 )^2 + j, i ) < deriv coefficients for state history interpolationCoefficients( ( o - 1 )^2 + j, o + i ) < deriv coefficients for deriv history
Order k occupies : registers ( k - 1 )^2 - k + 1 to k^2 - k - 1

memberdef.argsstring: (const StateDerivativeFunction &stateDerivativeFunction, const IndependentVariableType intervalStart, const StateType &initialState, const TimeStepType minimumStepSize, const TimeStepType maximumStepSize, const StateType &relativeErrorTolerance, const StateType &absoluteErrorTolerance, const TimeStepType bandwidth=200.)
memberdef.name: AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator

detaileddescription.para:
Default constructor, taking a state derivative function as argument. Note that with the default settings the integrator has no incentive of changing the stepsize.
stateDerivativeFunction
State derivative function.
intervalStart
The start of the integration interval.
initialState
The initial state.
minimumStepSize
The minimum step size to take. If this constraint is violated, an exception will be thrown and the next state is computed using the minimum value.
maximumStepSize
The maximum step size to take. If this constraint is violated, an exception will be thrown and the next state is computed using the maximum value.
relativeErrorTolerance
The relative error tolerance, for each individual state vector element.
absoluteErrorTolerance
The absolute error tolerance, for each individual state vector element.
bandwidth
(optional) bandwidth (between min and max tolerance) (200 default)
NumericalIntegrator::NumericalIntegrator.

memberdef.name: AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator

detaileddescription.para:
Default constructor, taking a state derivative function as argument. Note that with the default settings the integrator has no incentive of changing the stepsize.

minimumStepSize

maximumStepSize

relativeErrorTolerance
The relative error tolerance, for each individual state vector element.
absoluteErrorTolerance

bandwidth

memberdef.definition: virtual TimeStepType tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::getNextStepSize
memberdef.name: getNextStepSize

briefdescription.para: Get step size of the next step.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the step size of the next step. If the performIntegrationStep( stepSize ) function is used during a variable stepsize scheme, this function can be used to find out which stepSize was deemed best for the next integration step by the integrator.
Step size to be used for the next step.

briefdescription.para: Get the order of next step.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the order of the next step
Order of the next step

memberdef.name: getStepSize

briefdescription.para: Get step size of the last step.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the step size of the last step. If the step size is not defined by the user, the step size of last step can be retrieved with this function.
Step size to be used for the last step.

memberdef.definition: virtual StateType tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::performIntegrationStep
memberdef.name: performIntegrationStep

detaileddescription.para:
Perform a single integration step.
stepSize
The step size to take.
The state at the end of the interval,

Perform a single integration step. The stepSize as computed by integrator during the last stop.
The state at the end of the interval.

memberdef.definition: virtual bool tudat::numerical_integrators::AdamsBashforthMoultonIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::rollbackToPreviousState
memberdef.name: rollbackToPreviousState

briefdescription.para: Rollback internal state to the last state.

detaileddescription.para:
Performs rollback of internal state to the last state. This function can only be called once after calling integrateTo( ) or performIntegrationStep( ) unless specified otherwise by implementations, and can not be called before any of these functions have been called. Will return true if the rollback was succesful, and false otherwise.
True if the rollback was successful.

briefdescription.para: Replace the state with a new value.

detaileddescription.para:
Replace the state with a new value. This allows for discrete jumps in the state, often used in simulations of discrete events. In astro, this relates to simulations of rocket staging, impulsive shots, parachuting, ideal control, etc. The modified state, by default, cannot be rolled back; to do this, either set the flag to true, or store the state before calling this function the first time, and call it again with the initial state as parameter to revert to the state before the discrete change.
newState
The value of the new state.
allowRollback
Boolean denoting whether roll-back should be allowed.

Return the truncation error to be estimated by computError( ).
Double value of the truncation error.

simplesect.para: Vector of the absolute truncation error.
Vector of the relative truncation error.

detaileddescription.para:
Return the last value of the derivative
last derivative value

fixedStepSize
false or true to ( un)set fixed step size (default false).

fixedOrder
false or true to ( un)set fixed order (default false).

order
desired.

For a error vector to be better than another all its elements must be equal or small. Not strict compares the norm of the vectors instead.
strictCompare

memberdef.name: errorCompare

detaileddescription.para:
Compares two errors (absolute and relative form) and return true if first one is better than second (smaller is better).
absoluteError1
absolute error one.
relativeError1

absoluteError2
absolute error two.
relativeError2
relative error two.
true if one is better than two, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if error is too large.

detaileddescription.para:
Checks error (absolute and relative form) and return true if the exceed tolerance limits.
absoluteError
absolute error.
relativeError
relative error.
true if one error is too big, false if within limits

briefdescription.para: Checks if error is too small.

detaileddescription.para:
Checks error (absolute and relative form) and return true if the exceed tolerance limits.
absoluteError
absolute error.
relativeError
relative error.
true if one error is too small, false if within limits

briefdescription.para: Adams-Bashforth-Moulton Variable Order and Stepsize integrator.

detaileddescription.para:
Class that implements the Adams-Bashforth-Moulton integrator, variable order, variable step size integrator.
StateType
The type of the state. This type should support addition with StateDerivativeType.
StateDerivativeType
The type of the state derivative. This type should support multiplication with IndependentVariableType and doubles.
IndependentVariableType
The type of the independent variable.
NumericalIntegrator.
